spec.name: Test Reporting System
spec.description: Comprehensive test reporting system specification that ensures clear, accurate, and persistent test tracking.

requirement.description: All test categories MUST be tracked persistently
requirement.rationale: Test counts should remain visible even when collection fails

requirement.description: Report ALL known test levels and categories
requirement.rationale: Users need complete visibility into all available test categories
requirement.known-levels: smoke, unit, agents, integration, critical, comprehensive, comprehensive-backend, comprehensive-frontend, comprehensive-core, comprehensive-agents, comprehensive-websocket, comprehensive-database, comprehensive-api, all, real_e2e, real_services, mock_only

file.purpose: Main dashboard with all components and categories

anti-pattern.name: Missing Categories
anti-pattern.description: Never hide test categories that exist
anti-pattern.solution: Always show all known categories, even with 0 tests

anti-pattern.name: Lost Test Counts
anti-pattern.description: Test counts disappearing when collection fails

anti-pattern.name: Confusing Status
anti-pattern.description: Unclear or ambiguous test status reporting
anti-pattern.solution: Use clear icons and explicit status messages

anti-pattern.name: Legacy Artifacts
anti-pattern.solution: Single comprehensive reporter as source of truth

test-case.name: Persistent counts
test-case.verify: Test counts remain after collection failure

test-case.name: Clear status icons
test-case.verify: Each status has distinct icon and message

learnings.learning: Enhanced reporter was causing confusion with missing categories. Solution: Created comprehensive_reporter.py with all known categories.
Test counts were disappearing on collection failures. Solution: Added persistent test_state.json tracking.
Multiple report formats were creating legacy artifacts. Solution: Unified under comprehensive_reporter as single source of truth.
